column5: I have this crank bait that is no longer made and is very hard to find.  I was wondering if anyone here has any experience molding their own crack baits?  The good thing is I have a lure I want to replicate, so I have the design already, I just need to know how to replicate it? I was hoping for some personal experience on this, or information...  Thanks

Do you have a picture of your lure? or name of the lure. My buddy buys Ugly Ducklings from ebay, that lure you just don't find in stores. I have a friend that is head of a antique lure club. I could ask him a few questions on your lure if you like. The link below may help http://www.luremaking.com/catalogue/catalogue-index/crankbait_components-index.htm
Watch Larry Dahlberg, he knows what he's doing and could certainly help a few who want to get into this stuff.  <object width="480" height="385"><param name="movie" value="

Hey Fish Farmer, here is the pic of the lure, and thanks, I know it's Ukko, and the model is U-12 wobbler I believe, around 4.5" long, colour doesn't matter:     Thanks Roy, that video was great, when things go right I'll post my successes, fingers crossed.

Hooker, I emailed my friend the antique lure collector. I'll post his info when he gets back to me. I've never heard of that make of lure, sure looks interesting, it looks a little like a Reef Runner lure. Be nice if we could get you on to some or a little info.
Hooker I found this on Ebay, looks like he has a few http://cgi.ebay.ca/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=300352109424#ht_500wt_956  http://fishergears.com/products/Ukko,-lure.html

Please stop calling me a Hooker, haha.  Yeah, I seen those, unfortunately they are the larger ones, 16cm and 20cm.  I'm looking for the 12cm ones.  I did find some sites that appear to sell Ukko wobblers, but they are all in Germany, and quite expensive, around $23 CAN.  Thanks.  Funny, I purchased some reef runners, thinking they are close, just like your pic, but just not as good.

I'm sorry Hooked, I got to get new glasses. I did see you were on other sites inquiring. I'll let you know what my buddy say's when he gets back to me. I see you live in Stoney Creek, I lived there most of my life on Margaret Ave.S. from 1954 Sorry again Hooked
No problem at all Fish Finder.  Yeah, I live pretty close to Margaret, I was actually very close to buying a house on that street.
